programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Two deals are on the line as the team races to get a classic Dodge Viper car from the Dominican Republic and an Apache speedboat from the local marina.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Roy hires bodyguards to keep order at an auction, and Paul tries to stop Bogart from quitting.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Patrick Pecker fills in for Don at the auction in Western Road, and Cindy tries to take advantage of the change.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank have an unsuccessful search through a pile of junk, but the discovery of a vintage guitar marks a change in their fortunes.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank pick through the junk at an airport and are tempted by vintage pedal cars. However, they find the owner will not part with them easily.

programme.title: Billy the Exterminator Goes North
programme.desc: Billy faces a new challenge as he takes on the biggest and baddest critters of the Great White North.

programme.title: Billy the Exterminator Goes North
programme.desc: Billy faces a new challenge as he takes on the biggest and baddest critters of the Great White North.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick challenges a new painter to prove his skills in a contest with Countign Cars' Horney Mike, and a client brings in a 1970s wet bike.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A new picker goes out on his first trip, while Rick tries to fix up a 1950s ice cream cart.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The fearsome and mysterious gods worshipped by the Norse Vikings, considering whether the super-beings that guided the Vikings were actually visitors from another planet.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The movement known as Ancient Astronaut Theory, which was sparked by Erich von Daniken, Swiss author of several books which make controversial claims about extraterrestrial influences on early human culture.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank meet a racing driver and inspect his collection of motoring memorabilia, and also gamble on buying some vintage pilots equipment.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike is tempted by a retro smoking toy he finds in New Hampshire and needs Frank's bargaining skills to ensure a good price.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones endure disappointment at an auction, but hope a container they have secured at another site will make their day worthwhile.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Storage auction enthusiasts in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, are not pleased when Allen Haff and Ton Jones arrive in town searching for bargains.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: A Miami auction presents Ton Jones and Allen Haff with a big score, including a Delta Relay Rocket and a camouflage hovercraft, but they struggle to make a good profit.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Chicago, where they find a 1984 Yamaha snowmobile, a rare autographed baseball glove and a 1950s Robby the Robot toy.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders discover a coffin inside a storage unit in Chicago and hope it does not contain any unpleasant surprises. They also find a collection of toxic grenades.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders take on wealthy opponents at an Ontario auction, where they find a remote-controlled model of a Viper FanJet aircraft and a 1920s field camera.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff is intrigued by a lot containing high-quality tools and antique furniture, but struggles to outbid his new rival. Plus, a 1930s dynamite detonator box is discovered.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys unearth an 1897 Winchester 16-gauge shotgun and a pair of stuffed animals on their visit to Orange County.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys are keen to win a climate-controlled unit stuffed with contemporary art, but they have some competition. Plus, Clinton has a hunch about a quad bike.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones take a tactical approach to secure a big result at a storage auction, after spotting fishing tackle, a boat motor and instruments in a pair of units.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary learns a harsh lesson about Dave at auctions in Rancho Palos Verdes, California, while Rene puts a secret strategy to the test.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary is forced far out of her comfort zone when the buyers head to Indio, California. Lockers in this desert town hold many treasures, but it remains to be seen who will buy them.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Man in Black Is Back in Black
programme.desc: Dave Hester returns to the auction circuit, Darrell tries to get Brandon into shape, and Jarrod and Brandi's latest purchase leads them on a wild ride.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Mogul's Return
programme.desc: Jarrod goes bidding with a hangover which Brandi fears will hold him back, while Dave will not let a fight with Laura keep him away from an auction.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell tries to learn more about the mysterious Mogul, Jarrod and Brandi try not to let Dave distract them, and Ivy makes a find that leads to an adventure on the high seas.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon return to a town where they have always enjoyed good luck in the past - but this time, Dave is the one who comes out on top.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Deep in the Heart of Upland
programme.desc: A surprise visitor from Texas attends the latest heated round of auctions, which goes badly for the bidders but ends in a spectacular climax.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan and Laura have a crisis on their hands, and Brandi tries to make sure Jarrod focuses on the auctions.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter: Most Wanted
programme.desc: Things get heated as Dog and his team agree to help Leland's new boss with what Dog calls an Alabama Sweep, as they attempt to track down five fugitives in Alabama in a week.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After a challenging preliminary, the two finalists must re-create one of the Ottoman Empire's most lethal sabres - the Kilij.

programme.title: The Curse of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: With only one shot left to convince Marty to join their search, the team heads west where new clues are revealed.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Pilot of the series following colourful life in a large pawn shop, as run by the Gold family. From alligators to false limbs, its staff has no idea what could come through the door next, and profits come with a huge risk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a boer head in hope of a trade, and a woman wants cash for a fur coat despite the summer heat. Series following life in a large pawn shop..

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A threatening customer puts the store on a high alert, while Ashley and Seth bet on whether a stripper's pole will sell.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash over whether they should be armed after Les's confrontation with a customer, and Ashley fails to close a deal.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave reveals the secrets of how television is made, and examines the nature of happiness with the help of Kate Middleton's clothes and Thomas the Tank Engine.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Canadian stand-up Katherine Ryan takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with Pointless co-presenter Richard Osman and comedian Desiree Burch joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: Josh gets dumped by his girlfriend, so Owen takes him on a double date with a couple of voracious older women. Meanwhile, an e-mail mix-up leads to Kate breaking Geoff's heart. Sitcom, co-written by and starring Josh Widdicombe, with Elis James, Beattie Edmondson and Jack Dee.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: Owen, Kate and Josh head to the local curry house, where they bump into some old acquaintances from university. As the night progresses, rumour and intrigue come to the fore and the trio discover that some secrets are best left unrevealed. Spice Girl Emma Bunton guest stars, with John Widdecombe, Elis James, Beattie Edmondson and Jack Dee.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: It a proud day for Josh's football team - Plymouth Argyle - as they have reached the Football League Trophy Area Final Southern Section. Unfortunately, Owen's cousin has moved in on probation and is hogging the television with his N64 video game console. Meanwhile, Kate helps her mother dump her new boyfriend. Comedy, starring Josh Widdicombe, Jack Dee and Beattie Edmondson.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: The comedian and Susan Wokoma arrange to catch up over Austrian Tapas at Kipferl, Mexican tacos from Taquieria and jerk chicken burgers at Boom Burger.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: The comedian is joined by fellow funnyman Ed Gamble. After a pulled pork sandwich with a difference, Nick gets competitive and they are taught how to make sushi at Nippon kitchen.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The former wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Military and local police team up for a joint operation to destroy clandestine airstrips being used for smuggling cocaine deep in the jungles of Guatemala.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Colombian special forces go deep into guerrilla territory to locate and destroy a cocaine laboratory, while Guatemalan police target a drug gang extorting local businesses.

programme.title: Border Interceptors
programme.desc: The work of the men and women who protect Ireland's borders on a daily basis, capturing the frontline work of the numerous agencies at multiple locations around the country.

programme.title: Border Interceptors
programme.desc: Officer James O'Hearne has to deal with a passenger who has no passport and no form of identification, while a Chinese lady who has just arrived from Toronto faces being deported.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. Future host Matt LeBlanc is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme River Challenge
programme.desc: The naturalist travels down the Baliem River in New Guinea from its source to the sea, hoping to encounter the ancient tribes and dangerous wildlife that live long its banks and in the surrounding jungle. He begins his journey inland at Lake Habbema, and braves some of the world's fiercest white water rapids. Along the way, he stays in a village belonging to the Dani tribe and ventures into some previously unexplored caves.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: After a mammoth pick on a 25-acre homestead, the guys comb through the largest collection of sideshow memorabilia they have ever seen.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A highly strung collector turns out to be a handful for the guys, while Danielle goes to New York City for an auction of rock-legend memorabilia.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys try to move a 1929 Roadster safely down a decaying 100-year-old elevator.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary, Mel Giedroyc, Josh Widdicombe and Matt Dawson join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Stand-up star David O'Doherty, Pointless co-host Richard Osman, comedienne Susan Calman and weather presenter Carol Kirkwood join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Stand-ups Sarah Millican and Jon Richardson, actor David Harewood and comic Bob Mortimer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme River Challenge
programme.desc: The naturalist travels down the Baliem River in New Guinea from its source to the sea, hoping to encounter the ancient tribes and dangerous wildlife that live long its banks and in the surrounding jungle. He begins his journey inland at Lake Habbema, and braves some of the world's fiercest white water rapids. Along the way, he stays in a village belonging to the Dani tribe and ventures into some previously unexplored caves.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Customs and Border Protection officers think they have spotted a trend when they seize drugs from behind the dashboards of two cars. A Mexican woman asks officers for protection.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A man kidnapped and beaten by a Mexican drug cartel flees across the bridge into America. At Progreso International Bridge, a woman is caught hiding anti-anxiety pills in her bra.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Canadian stand-up Katherine Ryan takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with Pointless co-presenter Richard Osman and comedian Desiree Burch joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Matt Lucas, Holly Walsh and Susan Calman join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig opens her post in a post-themed edition. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: An evening of comedy at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London. Ventriloquist Nina Conti comperes the event, with a little help from her monkey, before introducing routines by stand-up stars Rob Beckett and Jimeoin.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Independent, a skyscraper in Austin, Texas. At a height of 690ft, it is the tallest building in the city, surpassing the 683ft Austonian, another residential skyscraper.

programme.title: Shakespeare - The Legacy with John Nettles
programme.desc: The actor examines the life of the Bard, investigating key moments and trying to discover what may have happened in a seven-year gap where he disappears from historical records.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part one of two. The French general's 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt, providing a base from which to attack English territory in the Indies.

programme.title: Surviving Alcatraz: Escaping the Rock
programme.desc: Scientists investigate a 1962 breakout from the island prison, to determine whether the escapees drowned while fleeing in a makeshift raft or if they safely made it to the mainland.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: The documentary concludes with an insight into Hitler's plans to modernise the German transport system, including super trains and futuristic airports.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The history of the concentration camp, charting its origins as a place to hold political prisoners through its development into a mechanised factory for mass murder. The first episode features the accounts of Polish inmates held there prior to the Holocaust, Jewish survivors and a former SS officer, who discusses being placed in charge of a firing squad.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Despite later claiming he was only following orders, Hoess was instrumental in the development of Auschwitz for mass murder, arranging for Soviet prisoners to be brought in as construction workers and scouring Europe for more victims to kill. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: Examining the complex system the Nazis set up to implement the extermination of the Jewish race throughout Europe from 1942, with Auschwitz as the hub. The programme reveals that at other camps, including Treblinka, Belzec and Sobibor, rival commanders participated in the genocide with enthusiasm and shared ideas for the best method of mass murder.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An eerie, empty country village which hides a sad secret, a mysterious tower battered by the elements and a disused railway deep beneath the streets of a city.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The series examining some of the UK's landmarks continues, with a look at the history of subterranean London, uncovering Roman remains, plague pits and secret bunkers under the capital's streets.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Herbert Rowse Armstrong, who was convicted of murdering his wife with arsenic. Much of the evidence against him was circumstantial and the scientific testimony remains disputed. This episode examines both sides of the case and asks whether the British justice system made a terrible mistake.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Henri Landru, who targeted lonely and vulnerable women during the First World War. He seduced them with promises of marriage and lured them to houses outside Paris where the women vanished. With the police uninterested in investigating the disappearances, two women took it upon themselves to pursue Landru.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: A medal for bravery, a suicide pill and an unlikely hiding place all add up to a confusing time for reluctant resistance fighter Rene, who determines to flee to England with Yvette instead of the two British airmen Fairfax and Carstairs.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.sub-title: Up the Crick Without a Piddle
programme.desc: Rene and Edith are rewarded with medals by Churchill after being transported to England in place of the British airmen, and are reunited with an old friend who has changed sides.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General Von Klinkerhoffen, tiring of the amount of Resistance propaganda in town, decides to restart the local newspaper, and appoints Rene and Alphonse to run it.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An Albanian village home to Allied secret agents, devastated for resisting the Nazi war machine, and a notorious asylum in America that enforced lobotomies.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The resourceful barrister defends an Army chaplain accused of murdering his brother. His efforts are not exactly helped by the client's refusal to speak - leaving him to wonder whether he is suffering from shell-shock brought on by a tour of Bosnia or whether he has something to hide. Starring John Thaw, with John Wood, Richard Pasco, Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Robert begins a career as a journalist and Geoffrey joins a gym to help Hetty solve a case for her hairdresser, whose errant husband has a lot to hide following an apparently random attack in a gents' toilet.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuth goes to North Yorkshire to meet her long-lost cousin Kate, and ends up investigating a case of demonic visitations. Amiable Geoffrey joins her in an attempt to provide moral support - and is soon drawn into his own little mystery.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Lizzie must deal with her mother's bold defence of the York cause, while the appearance of a boy in Burgundy claiming to be a young prince threatens to further destabilise King Henry's rule. King Henry's mother Lady Margaret Beaufort faces the consequences of harbouring a dark secret. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron feels increasingly isolated as the day of Janet and Angus's wedding approaches and Dr Finlay is drawn toward the new National Health Service. Rural medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gina warns Amber not to tell a soul about her cancer, but any hopes of keeping her illness secret are dashed when she's prescribed a course of daily radiotherapy. Scott reacts badly to the news that Greg's murder charges have been dropped, and Lance's latest assignment on the Cole Lane Estate proves something of a damp squib. Gabriel gives Sheelagh the brush-off, while Reg isn't quite sure what to make of Sun Hill's eager new receptionist Julian Tavell, known as JT.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Honey can't bring herself to contemplate the terrifying prospect that fiance Scott might have murdered his first wife, despite Yvonne and Steve's suspicions that there might be something to Greg's allegations. Lance tries to get the Cole Lane Estate's teenage population interested in cricket, hoping to bridge the generation gap and recruit informers at the same time, but his best efforts are jeopardised when Gary sets up a bungled drugs bust.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Dan Casper arrives at Sun Hill, and immediately risks life and limb to rescue a girl attempting to kill herself on a dual carriageway. Unfortunately, despite his best efforts, the case has a tragic ending. Scott manipulates Honey into setting a date for their wedding, and Gina tells Smithy she's suffering from cancer, while Gary makes himself unpopular by criticising the boys in uniform.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: JT unwittingly puts a woman's life in jeopardy by sending her to the house of serial rapist Alan Kennedy, forcing Samantha and Terry to abandon a covert surveillance operation and rush to her rescue. Reg and Tony arrest two squabbling burglars and Smithy urges Gina to give up smoking, while Ramani is astounded to overhear Margaret and Roger discussing her love life - or lack of one.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Robert begins a career as a journalist and Geoffrey joins a gym to help Hetty solve a case for her hairdresser, whose errant husband has a lot to hide following an apparently random attack in a gents' toilet.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuth goes to North Yorkshire to meet her long-lost cousin Kate, and ends up investigating a case of demonic visitations. Amiable Geoffrey joins her in an attempt to provide moral support - and is soon drawn into his own little mystery.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's A Dinner of Herbs
programme.desc: First in a two-part drama, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. The youngster soon makes friends with a local girl and the future looks rosy - but heartbreak is waiting just around the corner. With Tim Healy, Jonathan Kerrigan and Michael Jayston.

credits.actor: Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's A Dinner of Herbs
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part drama based on the novel by Catherine Cookson, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. With Tim Healy, Jonathan Kerrigan and Michael Jayston.

credits.actor: Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The amateur sleuth is presented with a fresh challenge to her deductive powers while holidaying at the plush Bertram's Hotel in London - a case involving a cleric whose disappearance is seemingly linked to an Irish train robbery. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, Caroline Blakiston and Joan Greenwood.

programme.title: The Casual Vacancy
programme.desc: Tensions rise in Pagford as the parish council election approaches and each side steps up its campaign, with the fate of Sweetlove House hanging in the balance. Meanwhile, Miles pines for a quiet life and promises Samantha that once the vote is over everything will calm down, but she doesn't believe him, and Howard's dark secret is revealed in the Ghost's final post. Krystal returns home to find Terri back to her old ways, Hope seems more fragile than ever and news of a tragedy leaves the whole community reeling.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: The NLF want to make a trade. Alison watches over Ed, feeling conflicted over their marriage. Yusra smuggles a coded message to Armstrong, and Joe goes against his orders.

programme.title: American Gangster (2007)
programme.desc: The story of 1970s drug kingpin Frank Lucas, whose innovative methods of smuggling heroin into the US made him one of the leading figures in the New York underworld. A detective is assigned to bring Lucas's empire down, but his investigation is undermined by police corruption. Ridley Scott's fact-based crime drama, starring Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Josh Brolin.

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: Comedian Vic Reeves meets a car that is part aeroplane. He also cruises along in a car fit for royalty and takes the wheel of a British sports iconic vehicle.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Old partners Aaron Grotjahn and Col Duff reunite on a prospecting mission. Meanwhile, the Tunnel Rats race to protect their claim as rival miners close in.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: The truckers move millions of pounds worth of Army vehicles through the streets of Wiltshire for the annual Trowbridge Armed Forces Day.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team designs a custom motorcycle for McCuff Industries, but the project stalls when problems arise due to a miscalculation.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Dan sets out to restore a rusty 1957 Bel Air, bought by Ovide unseen. Plus, disabled driver Dino wants serious speed in his '69 Super Bee.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead try to arouse the passion of the Saab enthusiast community by restoring a rusty, non-driving 1973 Saab 96 to its past glory.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Gel Caps/Playground Spring Riders/Frozen Pancakes/Natural Rubber
programme.desc: How gel caps, playground spring riders, frozen pancakes and natural rubber are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at how paper umbrellas, coal, aircraft seats and cremation urns are made.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.sub-title: India's Monkey Man Monster: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: An investigation into the 2001 sightings of a strange monkey-like creature in New Delhi, which attacked residents and leapt from rooftops.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien arrive in York, where Henry struggles to squeeze into some motorcycle leathers and Simon gets into deep water when he tries to restore an aluminium boat.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours sites around the UK for potentially valuable scrap items and forgotten remnants.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Huddersfield Town v Wigan Athletic, Hull City v Charlton Athletic, and Reading v Stoke City.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's finest finds and most premium picks in the first series, showcasing the best of their adventures and ultimate restorations.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's travel all over America in search of the most interesting, rare and profit-bringing treasures, from old bangers to classic toys.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: American rarities found by Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', featuring items from old bangers to classic toys.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Memorable moments featuring items that brought in major sums of cash or turned out to be near-worthless.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.sub-title: Picks of the Rich and Famous
programme.desc: Some of Mike and Frank's finest finds and most premium picks, related to the rich and famous.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Sean asks Dan to find a 1969 Camaro that can be built into the custom resto-mod of his dreams. Plus, Jeff wants to give his 1969 Cutlass a rare Hurst makeover.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a rust-free Triumph TR6 sports car from the 1970s that he wants to restore, but first mechanic Edd China has to rebuild the engine.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien arrive in York, where Henry struggles to squeeze into some motorcycle leathers and Simon gets into deep water when he tries to restore an aluminium boat.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Three British farmers try to run three very different family farms, revealing the challenges and rewards that come with making a living off the land.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours sites around the UK for potentially valuable scrap items and forgotten remnants.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Belgium on a continental buying adventure. He visits the flea market in Tongeren and meets a renowned dealer who lives in a huge chateau.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: After tracking Hitler's attempts to return to power through wealthy supporters in Argentina and Brazil, the investigators hits the ground in South America. An FBI report places Hitler in Colombia after unloading from a plane. Bob and John identify the marsh where they believe this aircraft was hidden, and gain access to use side-scan sonar to locate what could be the Nazi plane that shuttled Hitler to within 2,000 miles of the United States.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: After Kay Weden found her 77-year-old mother Catherine Miller shot dead in her home, investigators discovered the frozen remains of her boyfriend in the Blue Ridge Mountains. When investigators spoke with Kay, they realised that she was being stalked.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A look at the importance as evidence of blood, which can sometimes be the only means of identifying the killer in otherwise baffling murder cases.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Documentary on American serial killer Paul Durousseau, who murdered seven young women after being hired as a taxi cab driver in the south-east of the United States.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 17-year-old Bridgett Frisbie, who was lured to woodland near her Texas home town in April 2011 and shot dead. Her friend Alex Olivieri killed the teenager to prevent her revealing her knowledge of an earlier crime in which he was involved.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The case of the 1976 car bombing of Washington DC's Embassy Row that claimed the lives a former Chilean ambassador to America and his assistant. During the investigation, it became apparent that a foreign government ordered the attack.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Animal cruelty investigators Andy and Jeana help a skunk and cat trapped together in a storm drain. Officer Kelley finds a snake dumped on a golf course with a horrific injury.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown has an all-night marathon in a canine maternity ward, and a rabbit is hit with a bad case of heatstroke.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Magdalonie brings five very opinionated bridesmaids along with her for her dress appointment, while rugby player Michele, who has lymphoma, arrives with her fiance, mum and aunt.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I'm a Firm Believer in Signs
programme.desc: An American football player helps his sister choose a dress, and a bride wants a gown that compliments her personal tribute to her dead father.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Randy, I Think I Got This
programme.desc: A new consultant helps out with a surprise marriage proposal, while a former Miss USA has just one day to find the perfect dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney vet Dr Chris Brown attempts to help a lady who runs a shelter for abandoned donkeys. Lisa takes on a six-year-old apprentice who has arrived at Sash with her sick dog, Jelly.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown pays a visit to Kyabram Vet Clinic in the state of Victoria to lend a hand to an old friend.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. A tumultuous relationship with her husband caused Tamy Lyn's weight to reach more than 500lbs. Isolated from the outside world, she needs help to restart her life.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. A tumultuous relationship with her husband caused Tamy Lyn's weight to reach more than 500lbs. Isolated from the outside world, she needs help to restart her life.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Pauline's self-destructive behaviour continues to be a problem. While Chad continues his journey, June's progress stalls when she slips back into bad habits.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 21-year-old nursing student Maura Murray, who went missing in February 2004 minutes after being involved in a traffic collision. For no apparent reason she had driven 144 miles north from her campus and the accident was the second road incident she had suffered within two days.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Things heat up for Emma's wedding in Portugal.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: The work of a bridal salon specialising in gowns for plus-size women. Yukia and Yuneisia service curvier brides, from Christen, who lost her father as a child, and Zoe, a plus-size shop owner, to Gabby, who ordered her dress a size too small.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: Yukia Walker gets the chance to recreate her own wedding photos and become the bride she always wanted to be. Plus, Jennifer comes to the salon with a big entourage.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: Whitney Thompson, the first 'curvy' winner of America's Next Top Model, joins Yukia and Yuneisia to revamp a vintage dress that seems to be in questionable condition.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: A bride-to-be thinks she has lost her figure after giving birth, and a customer wants a colourful dress to wear to the reception.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: Yukia considers weight loss surgery as her diabetes gets worse, while a bride visits the shop looking for a dramatic outfit.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Zach lands his first date with a girl, inviting her to his school's formal winter banquet.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Matt Roloff races against time to finish renovating the kitchen for wife Amy.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy helps a single mum whose cat, Pickles, is terrifying her children. He also treats Lucifer, a cat whose food obsession may cost him his life.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Jennifer Francis finds a neglected pair of horses and a donkey, prompting the SPCA to battle for custody of the animals in court.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: I've Waited for This Call for 45 Years
programme.desc: Relatives attempt to make contact with lost friends and family. Chris Hanson hasn't seen his mother since he was six when she walked into a grocery store and never returned. Fifty-four-year old adoptee Paula wants to know why her parents kept her for a few days only to choose adoption and cut off all contact when she was still an infant. Hosted by Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: How, on a freezing Minnesota night, a ruthless shooting left a young police officer fighting for his life by the road. A tense manhunt for the three suspects ensued.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: People weighing over 600 pounds try to lose the weight that is threatening their lives.
